column4: If I partition my hard drive with a gentoo system rescue cd or somethin like that is it possible I could lose any information?
Why would you want to do that? =)
I'm partitioning my hard drive so I can dual-boot ubuntu and xp
...so why would you use a gentoo cd =)
I don't know, I was told that it has something to partition my drive with
so does the ubuntu live cd..
Well with the ubuntu live cd, is there a chance I might lose data?
Why would you lose data?? Just don't install ubuntu again!
I'm just trying to figure out if I should back up all my personal files before I partition my drive.
Whats on the drive right now
WinXP and all my personal files
Yeah, you're fine. Resize the partition with gparted, install ubuntu
The installer will actually do the resize for you
So you don't have to load the live cd, you can just do a complete install
I'm on an HP system, and I did that before then the stupid HP Recovery thing came up and stopped me then redid my hard drive so I lost all my data
Well tell the HP recovery thing to F-off if that happens again. See if you can turn it off in the bios or something
